result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis Md Collins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt (Felony/Battery/Theft) Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse AMENDED FROM ROBBERY WITH THREAT OF FORCE, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations.

No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family) - direct/indirect or by social media. No contact with the co-defendant. Defendant must write a letter of apology to the victim. Defendant must live with his mother unless receives permission from her and Agent to change residence. Counseling, treatment, services including Anger Management and Cognitive Therapy, as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must contact the First Apprenticeship Program. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: Community Service hours to be completed during term of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse AMENDED FROM ROBBERY WITH THREAT OF FORCE
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

PLUS $4,500 CO-SIGNATURE BOND SIGNED BY MOTHER, JOYCE COLLINS W/PHOTO I.D.
No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). No contact w/co-defendant.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant be placed on house arrest with electronic monitoring.  Zimmerman Consulting Inc (ZCI), located at 524 S Main St in Racine (262-632-1780) to monitor.  You are to report to their office immediately following your hearing or your release from custody. Defendant may attend school, church and work - but must provide hours to ZCI. Defendant may not attend the same school as the victim. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
